messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]half-birthdays/holiday babies
messages.msgSnippet: ... I know some families that just celebrate the half birthday in June, with a very small extra something on the real birthday.  My daughter was going to do
messages.messageBody:
>
> I must say I STILL haven't figured a great way to keep the Christmas
>girl's b-day from not 'blending in ' with the holiday.

I know some families that just celebrate the half birthday in June, with a
very small extra something on the real birthday. My daughter was going to
do that for her little girl, but it never happened.
Tia

No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
Eleanor Roosevelt
*********************************************
Tia Leschke
leschke@...
On Vancouver Island

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]half-birthdays/holiday babies
messages.msgSnippet: We really have the holiday birthdays at our house.....Oldest is Christmas Eve (11:33 p.m.....almost the first Christmas baby that year).  Our 3y.o. arrived
messages.messageBody:
We really have the holiday birthdays at our house.....Oldest is Christmas
Eve (11:33 p.m.....almost the first Christmas baby that year). Our 3y.o.
arrived 2-1/2 weeks early...I'm wondering if she just wanted to be born at
Easter! And finally, our littlest (1yo), came two weeks LATE!! He held
out for Halloween!!! Only one child was born on a non-holiday....poor thing
may feel left out around here.
I must say I STILL haven't figured a great way to keep the Christmas
girl's b-day from not 'blending in ' with the holiday.
Susan
----- Original Message -----
From: <starsuncloud@...>
To: <AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, December 11, 2001 5:43 PM
Subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Digest Number 29


> I really hope I'm doing this message stuff right....I've never been on an
> e-mail list like this so I'm not sure.
> Anyway...
> Tia, I thought Mimi's were a Southern thing!! Never heard it before moving
> down here.
> And we have a holiday baby too (another New Year's baby) and I'm sure
that's
> part of what prompted him to ask for the special day. We started out by
> calling it a Trevor day...then moved into the half Birthday thing.
> It's a great day because there is no pressure on me to do decorations or
> anything. It's simple, but fun.
> Karin,
> Nidoking left Pensacola around 1:30pm!!
> Hope he doesn't give the postmaster too much trouble.
> Ren
